column4: hey all, is it possible to update gnome environment without reinstalling ubuntu?
do you want to go from Kubuntu to Ubuntu or what?
I don't understand, I mean when I have an earlier version of gnome can i update it without reinstalling the system?
what version of Ubuntu are you on?
ubuntu 9.10
what was that a response to?
the version I'm running
the version I'm running 9.10
the version I'm running 2.28.1
so you need to upgrade gnome?  To which version?  Or do you just need to reinstall?  What problem are you having?
Idon't really have a problem, I just want to know how do I install or reinstall Gnome or upgrade a version without reinstalling the system
if you want to reinstall gnome, sudo apt-get install --reinstall gnome   But why do you need to reinstall it?  You got settings problems?
not really just wanted to know how it's done. just incase
reinstallations are rarely needed.  If you needed to reset the settings in your login, just delete the .gconf directory in your home directory.  Boom, factory setup.
Thanks m8
you got it
great help. may ask another question?
ask away
ldap
great thanks, I'm off reading (:
